newsitem.title: USA: Dow, Nasdaq languish at lower levels.
newsitem.headline: Dow, Nasdaq languish at lower levels.

text.p: Wall Street shares stuck to lower ranges in afternoon trading on Thursday, partly supported by a firmer bond market but generally sluggish.

The Dow industrial average was trading off 25 points or 0.35 percent at 7332, while the Nasdaq composite was off about four points to 1406. The long bond was trading off 12/32 at a seven percent yield.
Analysts said shares were softer after profit-taking, and amid various stock rating downgrades and negative corporate earnings announcements.
